newsitem.title: FINLAND: Nokia falls in tandem with Ericsson.
newsitem.headline: Nokia falls in tandem with Ericsson.

text.p: Profit-taking in Swedish Ericsson after expected nine-month profits and weak tone on the stock market sent Finnish telecoms group Nokia Oy lower in moderate afternoon trade on Tuesday, brokers said.
At 1400/1200 GMT, Nokia A share traded at 207.00 markka, down 8.50 markka or almost four percent. Trade was a moderate 75 million markka. Ericsson shares fell more than three percent.
"Players were long in Nokia and Ericsson and as Ericsson's profits matched expectations, they now take some profits," one broker said.
Nokia and Ericsson have been rising strongly in tandem since end-July.
